segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Catherine.
And today we're talking about a very important day in a couple's life.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论一对情侣生活中非常重要的一天。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to a wedding, but this time it's not going to be so romantic because actually the groom is having second thoughts about the wedding.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要去参加婚礼，但这次不会那么浪漫，因为新郎对婚礼有些犹豫。

segments.en: Okay, that means he's nervous and he's not positive he wants to get married today.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着他很紧张，并且不确定今天是否想结婚。

segments.en: So remember, the groom is the man, the bride is the woman.
segments.cn: 所以记住，新郎是男人，新娘是女人。

segments.en: Let's jump right into this dialogue, listen to what's going on, and when we come back we'll be talking about some of the words and phrases you've heard.
segments.cn: 让我们直接进入对话，听听发生了什么，回来后我们会讨论你听到的一些单词和短语。

segments.en: Man, I'm freaking out.
You gotta help me.
Whoa, whoa, take it easy, relax.
Geez, you're sweating like a pig.
What's going on?
I can't go through with this.
I just can't.
I'm not ready for marriage.
What was I thinking?
I'm only 35 years old.
I've got my entire life ahead of me.
Adventure's waiting.
I can't settle down yet.
What are you talking about?
It wasn't more than a month ago that you were rambling on about how you are tired of living the life of a bachelor and how you envy your friends that have a family.
segments.cn: 不到一个月前，你还在喋喋不休地说你厌倦了单身生活，羡慕有家庭的朋友。

segments.en: I know, I know.
Let's think this through.
First of all, you cannot leave Amy at the altar.
segments.cn: 首先，你不能在婚礼上抛下Amy。

segments.en: Not only will she be humiliated and kill you, but she is the woman that you love and the woman of your dreams.
segments.cn: 她不仅会感到羞辱并杀了你，而且她是你爱的人，是你梦想中的女人。

segments.en: Why would you want to end that or jeopardize it like this?
segments.cn: 你为什么要这样结束或危及这段关系？

segments.en: Second of all, you were just getting cold feet.
You know deep down inside that you want to marry her, so cut the crap and do it.
segments.cn: 你心里深处知道你想娶她，所以别废话，去做吧。

segments.en: You're right.
I'm being crazy.
Okay, I'm ready.
Let's do this.
Great.
Whew, that was a close one.
You had me going there for a minute.
I thought I was gonna have to slap some sense into you.
segments.cn: 我还以为我得给你点教训呢。

segments.en: Alright, we're back, so almost.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了，差点没结婚，但幸运的是你有个好朋友来帮你。

segments.en: He almost didn't get married, but luckily you have a good friend to help you out.
segments.cn: 没错，这个朋友真是救了场，确保新郎没有太紧张，并说了一些积极的话。

segments.en: Exactly, so this friend really saved the day, made sure that the groom didn't get too nervous, and had some really positive words.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听今天语言学习中的一些婚姻相关词汇。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to some of these marriage words in today's language takeaway.
Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，正如你提到的，我们有这个词婚姻。

segments.en: Alright, so as you mentioned, we have this word marriage.
segments.cn: 婚姻是名词形式，指的是结婚或已婚的状态。

segments.en: Now marriage is the noun form, right, of actually getting married or to be married.
segments.cn: 对，婚姻是名词，描述两个人之间的关系。

segments.en: Right, marriage is the noun, the word that describes the relationship between two married people.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你有一段关系，也许你在约会，但一旦你结婚，作为男人和女人之间的关系，就是你的婚姻。

segments.en: Okay, and so you have a relationship, maybe you're dating, but once you get married, the thing between you as a man and a woman, that's your marriage.
Your marriage.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我们的婚姻处于危险中。

segments.en: We need to work on our marriage.
segments.cn: 我们需要努力改善我们的婚姻。

segments.en: Exactly, or we have a happy marriage.
segments.cn: 没错，或者我们有一个幸福的婚姻。

segments.en: Alright, okay, so that's marriage.
Now if you get married, and this guy, he mentioned a phrase which was to settle down.
segments.cn: 如果你结婚，这家伙提到的一个短语是安定下来。

segments.en: To settle down.
This is a very important phrase, to settle down means to get serious, mature, and to stop living like a child.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的短语，安定下来意味着变得认真、成熟，停止像个孩子一样生活。

segments.en: It means really to have a house or to start having kids.
segments.cn: 这意味着真的有一个家或开始有孩子。

segments.en: It's a time in life.
segments.cn: 这是人生中的一个阶段。

segments.en: So to settle down is to become more stable, right?
segments.cn: 所以安定下来就是变得更稳定，对吧？

segments.en: As you say, to buy a house, to have a family, to stay in one place and not be so adventurous or stuff like that.
segments.cn: 就像你说的，买房子，组建家庭，待在一个地方，而不是那么冒险或类似的事情。

segments.en: Exactly, so it's to calm down and to be more fixed in life.
segments.cn: 没错，所以就是冷静下来，更加稳定。

segments.en: Alright, now the opposite of this would be to be a Right, so bachelor is a single man, someone who's not married.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在这个的反义词是单身，对吧，单身汉是指未婚的男人。

segments.en: And you often hear this term when we talk about apartments.
segments.cn: 当我们谈论公寓时，你经常会听到这个词。

segments.en: So bachelor pad is an apartment that's specific to a single man.
segments.cn: 所以单身公寓是专为单身男人设计的公寓。

segments.en: Usually there's lots of video games and a fancy TV and a pool table, exactly.
segments.cn: 通常里面有很多电子游戏、一个大电视和一个台球桌，没错。

segments.en: Alright, so bachelor, we had a lesson about this called bachelor party.
segments.cn: 好吧，单身汉，我们有一个关于这个的课程叫单身派对。

segments.en: Right, which is a party for a man right before he gets married.
segments.cn: 对，这是一个男人在结婚前的派对。

segments.en: And bachelor is a special word for a man who's not yet married.
segments.cn: 单身汉是指尚未结婚的男人的特殊词汇。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
And now as they were talking about not getting married, he said that you can't leave Amy at the altar.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论不结婚时，他说你不能在婚礼上抛下Amy。

segments.en: So you often hear this in movies, she got left at the altar or you can't leave her at the altar.
segments.cn: 你经常在电影中听到这个，她在婚礼上被抛下，或者你不能在婚礼上抛下她。

segments.en: This word altar is actually religious.
segments.cn: 这个词祭坛实际上是宗教的。

segments.en: Altar is the table in a church where the priest does all of his work.
segments.cn: 祭坛是教堂里神父进行所有工作的桌子。

segments.en: Alright, so an altar is a special religious table.
segments.cn: 好吧，祭坛是一个特殊的宗教桌子。

segments.en: So usually two people will stand in front of an altar and get married, right, with the priest who is doing his thing there.
segments.cn: 通常两个人会站在祭坛前结婚，对吧，神父在那儿做他的事情。

segments.en: Exactly, he says do Joe take Samantha to be your bride, blah, blah, blah.
segments.cn: 没错，他会说，乔，你愿意娶萨曼莎为妻吗，等等。

segments.en: So that happens at a special place called the altar.
segments.cn: 所以这发生在一个叫祭坛的特殊地方。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
It's also common in the normal mass, like on Sundays.
segments.cn: 在正常的弥撒中，比如在星期天也很常见。

segments.en: Right, okay.
And for the last word or phrase today, it's to get cold feet.
segments.cn: 今天最后一个单词或短语是感到紧张。

segments.en: You're just getting cold feet.
Okay, so this is a very funny phrase in English because it doesn't actually mean that your feet are cold, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这在英语中是一个非常有趣的短语，因为它并不意味着你的脚真的冷，对吧？

segments.en: So cold feet means you're nervous about something, you might change your mind.
segments.cn: 所以感到紧张意味着你对某事感到紧张，可能会改变主意。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay, so people often talk about men and women getting cold feet before a wedding.
segments.cn: 好吧，人们常常谈论男人和女人在婚礼前感到紧张。

segments.en: But you can also relate it to any other situation, not only getting married, right?
segments.cn: 但你也可以将其与任何其他情况联系起来，不仅仅是结婚，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, for example, I'm gonna go jump out of an airplane tomorrow.
segments.cn: 是的，例如，我明天要跳伞。

segments.en: Okay, fast forward, tomorrow.
Oh no, I have cold feet.
I don't think I want to jump out of an airplane.
Okay, so that's to get cold feet, to have second thoughts or doubts about actually doing something.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是感到紧张，对某事有第二次想法或怀疑。

segments.en: Exactly, cold feet.
Alright, so why don't we listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好吧，为什么我们不再听一次对话。

segments.en: Let's keep a lookout for all of these words, and we'll be back in a little bit.
segments.cn: 让我们留意所有这些单词，我们稍后会回来。

segments.en: Man, I'm freaking out.
You gotta help me.
Whoa, whoa, take it easy, relax.
Geez, you're sweating like a pig.
What's going on?
I can't go through with this.
I just can't.
I'm not ready for marriage.
What was I thinking?
I'm only 35 years old.
I've got my entire life ahead of me.
Adventure's waiting.
I can't settle down yet.
What are you talking about?
It wasn't more than a month ago that you were rambling on about how you are tired of living the life of a bachelor and how you envy your friends that have a family.
segments.cn: 不到一个月前你还在喋喋不休地说你厌倦了单身生活，羡慕有家庭的朋友。

segments.en: I know, I know.
Let's think this through.
First of all, you cannot leave Amy at the altar.
segments.cn: 首先，你不能在婚礼上抛下艾米。

segments.en: Not only will she be humiliated and kill you, but she is the woman that you love and the woman of your dreams.
segments.cn: 她不仅会感到羞辱并杀了你，她还是你爱的人和你梦想中的女人。

segments.en: Why would you want to end that or jeopardize it like this?
segments.cn: 你为什么要这样结束或危及这段关系？

segments.en: Second of all, you were just getting cold feet.
You know deep down inside that you'd want to marry her.
segments.cn: 你心里深处知道你想娶她。

segments.en: So cut the crap and do it.
You're right.
I'm being crazy.
Okay, I'm ready.
Let's do this.
Great.
That was a close one.
You had me going there for a minute.
I thought I was going to have to slap some sense into you.
segments.cn: 我还以为我得给你点教训呢。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
So now why don't we take a look at four key phrases that we found in this dialogue on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看在这个对话中找到的四个关键短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
This first one is a really great phrase because it's very, well, it's easy to picture this, what we're describing.
segments.cn: 第一个短语非常好，因为它很容易想象我们在描述的内容。

segments.en: Sweating like a pig.
To sweat like a pig.
Okay, you're sweating like a pig.
All right, this is a way to say that someone is sweating a lot.
segments.cn: 这是一种说法，表示某人出汗很多。

segments.en: A lot.
Okay, and it's really gross or disgusting.
Now, do pigs actually sweat?
I don't know if pigs actually sweat, but you imagine someone smells bad and they have, you know, sweat on their face and their back and their arms.
segments.cn: 我不知道猪是否真的会出汗，但你可以想象某人闻起来很糟糕，脸上、背上和手臂上都有汗。

segments.en: All right, well, sometimes don't you say you're sweating like a dog?
segments.cn: 好吧，有时你不是说你像狗一样出汗吗？

segments.en: You could also say that.
I guess we like animals in English, but this is just a really great way to say that someone is really sweaty.
segments.cn: 我想我们在英语中喜欢动物，但这真的是一种很好的说法，表示某人真的很出汗。

segments.en: All right, and well, he was sweating and he was really nervous because he said, I can't go through with this.
segments.cn: 好吧，他出汗了，因为他说，我无法继续下去。

segments.en: What does he mean go through with this?
segments.cn: 他是什么意思，继续下去？

segments.en: With what?
To go through with means to actually do something.
segments.cn: 继续意味着实际去做某事。

segments.en: Okay, so maybe I say I don't want to jump out of an airplane.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许我说我不想跳出飞机。

segments.en: I can't go through with this.
Okay, I can't jump.
So it depends on what we're actually talking about.
segments.cn: 所以这取决于我们实际在谈论什么。

segments.en: Okay, if we're talking about a wedding, you say I can't go through with this.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果我们在谈论婚礼，你会说我无法继续下去。

segments.en: I can't get married.
So if you're planning a robbery, you say, well, in the last minute, I couldn't go through with it.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在计划抢劫，你会说，最后一刻，我无法继续下去。

segments.en: I backed out.
Right, I can't complete what I talked about doing.
segments.cn: 对，我无法完成我所说要做的事情。

segments.en: Okay, and now the friend, he finally gets kind of angry and he says, cut the crap.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在朋友终于有点生气了，他说，别废话。

segments.en: Oh, man, this is a very common phrase.
segments.cn: 哦，伙计，这是个非常常见的短语。

segments.en: All right, this is this is someone says this if they don't want to listen to you complain anymore.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种说法，如果他们不想再听你抱怨。

segments.en: Okay, Marco, cut the crap.
Okay, I don't want to hear your excuses.
segments.cn: 好吧，我不想听你的借口。

segments.en: I don't want to hear your complaints.
I want to just hear solutions, solutions, ideas, positive things.
segments.cn: 我只想听解决方案、想法、积极的事情。

segments.en: So to cut the crap is no more complaints, no more excuses, or no more talking nonsense.
segments.cn: 所以别废话就是不再抱怨，不再借口，或不再说废话。

segments.en: Exactly.
And this is this is common among teachers and well, parents.
segments.cn: 这在老师和父母中很常见。

segments.en: All right, so cut the crap.
Now it's not very polite, right?
segments.cn: 现在这不是很礼貌，对吧？

segments.en: So you wouldn't really say to your boss or like a friend.
segments.cn: 所以你不会真的对你的老板或朋友说。

segments.en: Cut the crap is kind of rude and it's very spoken language.
segments.cn: 别废话有点粗鲁，而且是口语。

segments.en: So I wouldn't write it down.
And I would not use this with someone who is like a teacher.
segments.cn: 我也不会对像老师这样的人使用。

segments.en: Well, yeah, like an authority.
You don't use it with them.
They might use it with you.
Okay.
And for our last phrase, he said, you had me going there for a while or you had me going there for a minute.
segments.cn: 对于我们的最后一个短语，他说，你让我紧张了一会儿。

segments.en: Okay.
So this is a really interesting phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: We use this a lot in English, but it's not clear from listening to it what it might mean.
segments.cn: 我们在英语中经常使用这个，但从听上去并不清楚它可能意味着什么。

segments.en: So you had me going there in this sense means, oh, I was really nervous for a minute.
segments.cn: 所以你让我紧张在这个意义上意味着，哦，我真的紧张了一分钟。

segments.en: I really believed what you were saying.
segments.cn: 我真的相信你在说什么。

segments.en: Exactly.
So maybe we could give an example, Marco.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们可以给个例子，马尔科。

segments.en: All right.
Did you know that yesterday I won the lottery?
segments.cn: 你知道昨天我赢得了彩票吗？

segments.en: I mean, I won like a million dollars and I had the perfect numbers.
segments.cn: 我是说，我赢了大约一百万美元，我有完美的号码。

segments.en: Oh my God.
Really?
Can I have a million dollars?
segments.cn: 我可以要一百万美元吗？

segments.en: I would love to help you out, ma 'am.
But yeah, no, I didn't actually win a million dollars.
segments.cn: 但不，我实际上并没有赢得一百万美元。

segments.en: You had me going there for a minute.
You actually believed me.
You believed me.
Okay, maybe not.
He's not that gullible.
segments.cn: 他并没有那么容易上当。

segments.en: All right.
But that's what it means, right?
To believe someone's story or to think that something's going to happen even though it doesn't.
segments.cn: 相信某人的故事，或者认为某事会发生，即使它并没有发生。

segments.en: You had me going there.
That means what you thought was going to happen didn't happen.
segments.cn: 这意味着你认为会发生的事情并没有发生。

segments.en: So you can use it in the third person is like, yeah, I was telling him this awesome story and I really had him going for a while.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用第三人称来说，嗯，我在给他讲这个精彩的故事，我真的让他相信了一段时间。

segments.en: He really believed me and then I told him it wasn't true.
segments.cn: 他真的相信我，然后我告诉他这不是真的。

segments.en: Okay.
Great phrases.
Now let's listen to our dialogue for the last time and we'll be back to talk a little bit more about getting cold feet.
segments.cn: 现在让我们最后一次听我们的对话，然后我们会回来谈谈紧张的事情。

You got to help me.
Whoa, whoa.
Take it easy.
Relax.
Geez, you're sweating like a pig.
What's going on?
I can't go through with this.
I just can't.
I'm not ready for marriage.
What was I thinking?
I'm only 35 years old.
I've got my entire life ahead of me.
Adventure's waiting.
I can't settle down yet.
What are you talking about?

segments.cn: 不到一个月前，你还在喋喋不休地说你厌倦了单身生活，羡慕有家庭的朋友。

segments.en: I know.
I know.
Let's think this through.
First of all, you cannot leave Amy at the altar.
segments.cn: 首先，你不能在婚礼上抛下艾米。

segments.en: Not only will she be humiliated and kill you, but she is the woman that you love and the woman of your dreams.
segments.cn: 她不仅会感到羞辱并杀了你，而且她是你爱的人，是你梦想中的女人。

segments.en: Why would you want to end that or jeopardize it like this?
segments.cn: 你为什么要这样结束或危及这段关系？

segments.en: Second of all, you are just getting cold feet.
You know deep down inside that you want to marry her.
segments.cn: 你内心深处知道你想娶她。

segments.en: So cut the crap and do it.
You're right.
I'm being crazy.
Okay, I'm ready.
Let's do this.
Great.
That was a close one.
You had me going there for a minute.
I thought I was going to have to slap some sense into you.
segments.cn: 我还以为我得给你点教训呢。

segments.en: All right, so this is a popular scenario, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种常见的情况，对吧？

segments.en: Somebody on their wedding day, they get cold feet and they back out.
segments.cn: 在婚礼当天，有人紧张而退缩。

segments.en: TV, movies, books, everyone loves the situation.
segments.cn: 电视、电影、书籍，大家都喜欢这种情节。

segments.en: Have you ever actually heard of or experienced or maybe known of somebody who actually left the bride at the altar or the groom at the altar?
segments.cn: 你有没有听说过或经历过，或者认识谁在婚礼上抛下新娘或新郎？

segments.en: I don't know anyone who did that.
Luckily, I think it's really sad.
segments.cn: 幸运的是，我觉得这真的很悲哀。

segments.en: Yeah, me neither.
I don't think it's really that common.
No, but there was a movie just about this.
segments.cn: 不，不过有部电影就是讲这个的。

segments.en: So there's a woman, Julia Roberts, who tries and tries and tries to get married but never can.
segments.cn: 有个女人，朱莉亚·罗伯茨，她一次又一次地想结婚，但总是不能。

segments.en: So it's called Runaway Bride, because every time she goes to the altar, she gets nervous.
segments.cn: 所以这部电影叫《逃婚新娘》，因为每次她走到婚礼上，她就紧张。

segments.en: She gets cold feet and she runs away.
They call her the runaway bride.
I can't imagine this actually happening to someone.
segments.cn: 我无法想象这真的发生在某人身上。

segments.en: I mean, you have all your family there, your friends.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你的家人和朋友都在那儿。

segments.en: I know, it'd be so embarrassing.
It's amazing.
And expensive.
Exactly, because you've already paid for everything.
segments.cn: 正是，因为你已经为一切付过钱了。

segments.en: So do you get to eat the cake if you're the one who's left behind?
segments.cn: 那么，如果你是被抛下的那个人，你能吃蛋糕吗？

segments.en: I think so.
Everything's paid for, right?
segments.cn: 一切都已经付过钱了，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
And drink all the liquor.
All right, so that's all the time we have for today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的时间就到这里。

segments.en: If you have any questions, any comments, you can come to our website at EnglishPod.com, and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题或评论，可以访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye, everyone.
